column4: Hello I'm having problems with Ubuntu and flash and webcam support, specifically tinychat, I've posted it here:
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1466065
Could someone help me, thanks.
try right clicking on the flash object (im assuming its in browser) and there should be some settings to play with
flash10 + linux == broke, so I had to go to the settings manager, and "always allow"
it deffinatly is
well the first step would be to get flash working :P
flash does work.
i feel your pain, a long time ago (i forgot the process) but i was able to get my webcam workign with stickam and tinychat
ooo
let me see if i can refresh my memory
the little "broadcast preview" on tinychat I see myself, but when I enter the room with my cam, the cam shuts off.
did you setup your video device? /dev/video0 etc...
skype; webcam studio and everything shows me perfectly.
did you give the site permission to use your cam? i remember doing somethign with this page http://www.macromedia.com/support/documentation/en/flashplayer/help/settings_manager04.html
thats weird you said the video prevew works as well right?
maybe that actual flash applet is using a different domain?
other than that i have no idea
dotn give up though sounds like your close to solving your problem
there really isnt much ubuntu or linux can do about retarded shit like that, its all the manufactures shit
need to start writing drivers for linux so there cam can work out of the box
